monster.name: Bunyip

trait.name: Aquatic Finesse
trait.text: While swimming, the bunyip does not provoke reactions.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bunyip makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10+5) piercing.

action.name: Ferocious Speed (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bunyip takes the dash action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: After being hit with a melee or ranged attack, the bunyip reduces damage by half.

monster.description:
An aquatic monster dwelling in rivers and streams, bunyips are shaggy-furred predators with enormous incisors capable of moving and attacking with blinding speed. They live in family groups of three to eight, and travel together in packs to hunt fish and other prey.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 12 (Third Party)

monster.name: Chupacabra

trait.name: Drink Blood
trait.text: If the chupacabra inflicts necrotic damage on a living target, it gains temporary hit points equal to the damage inflicted.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Tongue Lash
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) necrotic damage. This attack leaves no mark on the target.

action.name: Blood Stun
action.text: If the chupacabra has temporary hit points, it can use this feature to release blood energy in a wide wave. Creatures within 30 ft.of the chupacabra must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn. The chupacabra loses any temporary hit points it possesses after using this feature.

monster.description:
Chupacabras are lean, lizard-like creatures with dark hairless bodies and sinister red eyes. They feast on the blood of other creatures which they draw out with their long tongues, leaving no trace of their presence, baffling farmers. Chupacabras live in small family units in underground tunnels running just below the surface of any environment.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 13 (Third Party)

monster.name: Death Worm

trait.name: Drag
trait.text: If the death worm hits with its bite attack against a prone target of Large size or smaller, the death worm can drag the target to an unoccupied space adjacent to it after using its movement speed.

trait.name: Momentum
trait.text: If the death worm moves at least 20 ft. while burrowing it gains advantage on melee attack rolls until the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The death worm makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8+3) slashing damage. If the death worm moved at least 20 ft. before attacking, the target must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw or take an additional 9 (2d8) damage and be knocked prone.

action.name: Venom Spray
action.text: The death worm releases a spray of deadly venom in a 60-foot cone. Creatures in this area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, creatures suffer 27 (6d8) poison damage and are blinded until the start of the death worm's next turn. Creatures succeeding on the saving throw suffer half damage and are not blinded.

monster.description:
A death worm is a long serpentine creature with hard plates along its back. A pair of barbed horns extend from either side of its massive jaws, and the creature moves through the earth as easily as a fish swims through water. They devour meat but their digestive system is slow, so they only need to surface once every month to feed.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 14 (Third Party)

monster.name: Dropbear

trait.name: Ambush Predator
trait.text: The dropbear has advantage on initiative checks. If the dropbear has advantage on a melee attack, it deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage if it hits with the attack.

trait.name: Leap
trait.text: The dropbear can jump up to 20 ft. with a standing long jump, and while jumping the dropbear does not provoke reactions. If the dropbear makes a melee attack after jumping at least 10 ft. it gains advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Untracable
trait.text: Dropbears do not leave any tracks in their wake.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

monster.description:
Dropbears resemble small ursine creatures with round ears and coarse, unkept fur. Their powerful back legs allow them to pounce on nearby targets with surprising force and ferocity and disappear just as quickly. They are scavengers, however, often choosing to eat corpses rather than reveal their presence.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 15 (Third Party)

monster.name: Greyhaven Devil

trait.name: Unnverving Aura
trait.text: Creatures starting their turn within 15 ft. of the Greyhaven Devil suffer disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their turn. Creatures immune to being frightened are immune to this aura.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Greyhaven Devil makes two hoof attacks.

action.name: Hoof
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Fire Breath
action.text: The Greyhaven Devil breathes a 30-foot cone of fire. Creatures caught in the cone must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, suffering 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Bray
action.text: The Grayhaven Devil lets out a horrendous bray. Creatures who can hear the bray within 120 ft. must make a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or suffer from the Confusion spell. Affected targets can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect with a success.

monster.description:
A Grayhaven Devil is a horrendous monster with the basic shape of a malnourished horse. Its back sprouts a pair of ragged leathery wings and its head has the aspects of a fanged goat. The creature's howling bray can be heard for miles, and it seems to delight in causing fear and panic among people living in towns.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 16 (Third Party)

monster.name: Hodag
monster.languages: understands Common but doesn't speak it

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hodag makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8+6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium size or smaller, the hodag throws the target up to 15 ft. in a direction of its choice. Targets thrown in this way must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8+6) slashing damage.

action.name: Perfect Camouflage (Bonus Action)
action.text: The hodag turns invisible per the invisibility spell (does not require concentration).

reaction.name: Spike Lash
reaction.text: After being hit with a melee attack, the hodag lashes out with its spikes, inflicting 15 (2d8+6) piercing damage to a target within 5 ft. of it.

monster.description:
A hodag's oversized maw is capable of tearing a person in half. They prefer to lair in dense swampy forests or shadowy cavern systems, emerging at dusk to hunt or scavenge. Hodags are voracious eaters capable of devastating entire ecosystems before moving on to fresher fields.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Jackalope

trait.name: Simple Telekinesis
trait.text: The Jackalope can cast the mage hand cantrip at will without requiring components. The spectral hand is invisible.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee weapon attack:L +6 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Induce Fear
action.text: The jackalope targets a creature it can see within 60 ft. with the phantasmal killer spell (spell save DC 13) requiring no components nor concentration. The spell lasts for 1 minute or until the target succeeds on their saving throw.

action.name: Disappear (Bonus Action)
action.text: The jackalope turns invisible per the invisibility spell (does not require concentration).

monster.description:
Jackalopes are rabbit-like creatures with a rack of ornate antlers perched atop their heads and a mouth of razor-sharp teeth. Their eyes radiate strange colors when they use their otherworldly powers on victims. Jackalopes are tricksters by nature and often cause havoc with their telekinetic abilities in towns and farms.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 19 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mkole-mbembe
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The mkole-mbembe can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Trample
trait.text: If the mkole-mbembe moves at least 20 ft. toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the mkole-mbembe can make one tail slap attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: River-Sentinel
trait.text: If another creature enters or damages its territory, the mkole-mbembe can sense it through subtle vibrations in the earth and water up to 120 feet away.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mkole-mbembe makes three attacks using any combination of gore, stomp and tail slap.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10+7) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8+7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d12 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

action.name: Primal Bellow
action.text: The mkole-mbembe lets out a powerful bellow. Each creature within 60 ft. must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Splash Wave
reaction.text: While in any amount of water, in response to being targeted with a melee attack, the mkole-mbembe slams its tail on the water and directs the splash at the attacker. The attacker suffers disadvantage on melee attacks targeting the mkole-mbembe until the end of its turn.

monster.description:
mkole-mbembe are massive reptilian creatures living in swamps, lakes and rivers. They have long, serpentine necks with rows of tall barbs running along its spine to the tip of their spike-lined tail. Fiercely territorial, they defend their waters with devastating charges and bone-rattling bellows, driving off hunters and monsters alike.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 20 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mothman

trait.name: Flyby Move
trait.text: The mothman does not provoke reactions while flying.

trait.name: Foresight
trait.text: Roll 2d20 and record each separate result. The mothman can replace the d20 result for any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check it makes or that another creature makes within 60 ft. of it with one of these results.

trait.name: Prescience
trait.text: Then mothman sees time differently than other creatures. The mothman cannot be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mothman makes two gaze attacks.

action.name: Gaze
action.text: Ranged spell attack: +7 to hit, range 60/180 feet, one target. Hit: 8 (2d6+5) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6+5) slashing damage.

action.name: Stunning Gaze
action.text: The mothman's eyes flare with energy. Creatures in a 60-foot cone must make DC 13 Wisdom saving throws or be stunned until the end of their next turn.

monster.description:
The mothman is often cloaked in darkness, its humanoid form hidden beneath layers of fine hair, which muffle its movements. A pair of large, hairy wings extends from its back, and its face is dominated by a set of enormous scarlet eyes. A mothman has a unique relationship with fate and destiny, and while they are generally solitary, one often appears before large natural disasters.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 22 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sasquatch

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The sasquatch can cast the following spells without requiring material components using Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, spell attack bonus +5).
• At will: entangle, pass without trace, speak with plants • 3/Day Each: freedom of movement, grasping vine, hallucinatory terrain, tree stride

trait.name: Strength of the Wild
trait.text: The sasquatch has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sasquatch makes two club attacks.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee weapon attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature of huge size or smaller, it is knocked prone.

action.name: Ground Pound
action.text: The sasquatch slams its fist on the ground, creating a powerful shockwave. Creatures on the ground within 30 ft. of the sasquatch must make DC 13 Constitution saving throws. On a failure, creatures suffer 14 (2d8+5) thunder damage and are knocked prone. On a success, the creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone.

monster.spells: Entangle, Pass Without Trace, Speak with Plants, Freedom of Movement, Grasping Vine, Hallucinatory Terrain, Tree Stride
monster.description:
A sasquatch is a powerfully built, broad-shouldered humanoid figure covered in shaggy hair, with long, muscular arms, giving it an overall ape-like appearance. They live in isolated, small family groups in wild settings, as far from civilization as possible, and they often work with druidic circles to protect the beauty of nature.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 23 (Third Party)

monster.name: Thinman

trait.name: Psychic Disturbance Field
trait.text: The thinman projects an area of psychic disturbance. Creatures starting their turn within 30 ft. of the thinman must make DC 15 Intelligence saving throws or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the start of the thinman's next turn. The thinman can disable or enable this aura as a bonus action.

trait.name: Thin Form
trait.text: Thinman can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The thinman makes three tendril attacks.

action.name: Tendril
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8+5) bludgeoning damage and 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Sprout Tendrils
action.text: The thinman casts black tentacles (DC 15) without requiring material components.

action.name: Ego Collapse
action.text: The thinman targets one creature within 60 ft. The target must make a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 36 (8d8) psychic damage and is blinded and deafened for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half damage and suffers no additional effects.

action.name: Bodily Transformation (Bonus Action)
action.text: The thinman can teleport up to 60 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see. It can pass through solid objects while doing so, but it cannot end its movement inside an object.

monster.description:
Faceless and tall, a thinman has pale skin beneath an exterior layer of sleek black slime, formed into a mockery of civilized clothing. Tendrils of its inky black exterior stretch out from its back, extending its already formidable reach. These creatures originate from another plane of existence, and their wants and desires are completely unknown.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 24 (Third Party)

monster.name: Psuedo Hydra

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The pseudo hydra has advantage on saving throws against spells and spell-like effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The pseudo hydra can cast the following spells without requiring material components using Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, spell attack bonus +8). The pseudo hydra can concentrate on up to four spell at once.
• At will: Fear, invisibility, major image, modify memory. • 3/Day each: Dream, mirage arcane, seeming • 1/Day each: Weird

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The pseudo hydra can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability heck.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The pseudo hydra makes four bite attacks. It can replace one of its bite attacks with an At Will spell from its Spellcasting feature.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d12+7) piercing damage plus 6 (1s12) psychic damage.

monster.spells: Fear, Invisibility, Major Image, Modify Memory., Dream, Mirage Arcane, Seeming, Weird
monster.description:
A psuedo hydra appears as a mass of pale, writhing, worm-like appendages sprouting from a central formless body. Some appendages end in long claws while others hold the hovering visage of a hollow-eyed face, mouths open at grotesque angles.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 26 (Third Party)

monster.name: Water Orm
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, cold

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The water orm can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Aquatic Ambusher
trait.text: The water orm has advantage on initiative checks while in the water.

trait.name: Slippery
trait.text: While in the water, the water orm can use its bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The water orm makes two bite attacks and performs a water blast.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10+5) piercing damage.

action.name: Water Blast
action.text: The water orm releases a blast of water in a 60-foot line. Creatures in the line must make DC 15 Strength saving throws or be pushed back 15 feet.

monster.description: Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Cryptids p. 27 (Third Party)
